result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Ray Erdmann

records.addlTxt:
Cases 22CF18 & 22TR184 called @ 9:03 AM: Attorney Dennis Michael Melowski appeared by phone for Randy Ray Erdmann. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court regarding the status of the case. Atty Melowski requests more time to review a transcript recently received. The Court orders any motion filed by Defense counsel to be done by November 18, 2022. Any response necessary from the State to be filed by November 30, 2022. The Court questions the parties regarding further scheduling. MH scheduled - NOH given.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Exhibits 1-3 - Exhibit 1 housed in vault drawer

Case called @ 2:08 PM Defendant Randy Ray Erdmann in court.  Attorney Dennis Michael Melowski in court for Randy Ray Erdmann.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Hearing to address Motion to Suppress filed by Atty Melowski. Statement by Atty Melowski regarding the motions filed. Statement by DA Leusink. The Court marks exhibits 1 & 2. DA Leusink offers exhibits 1 & 2. The Court receives exhibits 1 & 2. Sergeant Steven Kasubaski sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by DA Leusink. Witness identifies the defendant. Exhibit 3 marked. DA Leusink offers exhibit 3. No objection by Atty Melowski. The Court receives exhibit 3. 2:26 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Melowski. 2:40 p.m. Witness excused. Evidence closed. Argument by Atty Melowski. Argument by DA Leusink.The Court denies the motion to suppress based on misleading/coercive reading of the ITAF for reasons stated on the record. The Court will allow the parties to brief the balance of the motions. Atty Melowski requests that the briefs be due 30 days after the transcripts have been prepared. The Court will schedule a STC.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case called @ 2:05 PM Defendant Randy Ray Erdmann appeared in court with Attorney Brian Lee Mares. Atty Mares appears by phone. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Case called @ 01:02 PM Defendant Randy Ray Erdmann in court, in custody, appears via video.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is not eligible for SPD services. Defendant will privately retain counsel. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $1500 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
